text: Instagram will only notify you
if a screenshot has been taken
of a disappearing photo or video
sent in a private DM thread.

Instagram does not notify
you for screenshots
for Stories, posts, Reels, permanent DMs,
or any other content on the app.

When someone screenshots a
disappearing photo or video

you sent, a small hashed
circle will appear beside it.
Screenshots will also be notified
in the conversation summary,
where you'll see the note "Screenshot."

A disappearing photo or
video is one that is taken
using the camera within the Instagram app.

The message disappears
because the other user

can only view it once -- or
twice if you allow replay.

On the other hand, when you
send someone a photo or video

from your phone's camera
roll, you will not be notified
if someone screenshots it.

You can also screenshot other
content in a direct chat,

like individual messages,
conversation history,
and posts sent back and forth
without the other person being notified.

There are a few ways you
can prevent the other person
from being notified of your screenshot.
Put your phone in airplane mode.

If you screenshot the
disappearing photo or video
while your phone is in airplane mode,

the other party will not be
notified of the screenshot.

If the photo does not
load while your phone

is in airplane mode,
try opening the photo,
holding your finger down on it,
and quickly turning on airplane mode
while the photo is still open.
Then, with the photo already loaded
and your phone now in airplane mode,
you can take a quick screenshot.

If you log on to Instagram in
a web browser on your computer
and go to your direct messages,

you can take a screenshot of
a disappearing photo or video
without the person knowing.
Instagram does not notify you
for screenshots taken in a web browser.

While these methods will avoid
the screenshot notification,

you should never use or
share someone's image,
sensitive content, or personal information
without their consent.
